In 2023, there will be several holidays in Romania, including:
* New Year's Day on January 1 and January 2
* Day of the Unification of the Romanian Principalities on April 24
* Good Friday on April 22
* Orthodox Easter on April 24-25
* Labor Day on May 1
* Children's Day on June 1
* Orthodox Pentecost on June 12
* The day after the Orthodox Pentecost on June 13
* Assumption on August 15
* Saint Andrew on November 30
* Romania's National Day on December 1
* Christmas on December 25 and December 26
answers.bResponse:

answers.answer: Yes, you can exchange UAH for RON at BCR. The Romanian Commercial Bank offers exchange between UAH and RON, up to 1,000 lei per person/Ukrainian passport, at the exchange rate of the BNR. This service is available at 11 BCR branches located at the border areas, which operate 24/7. Additionally, if you require assistance in financial-banking services, you can contact BCR through their dedicated telephone line or email address.

According to the provided summary, Useful contacts for Ukrainian refugees include the following organizations:

* Use the Apel 112 App, which automatically transmits geographic coordinates from your mobile phone to the 112 Service if you have an active data connection and a compatible phone with location functionality. The app is available in both English and Romanian.
* Call +40 021.9590 to reach the Romanian Border Police, where you can obtain public information about crossing or border areas.
answers.bResponse:
According to the provided summary, Useful contacts for Ukrainian refugees include the following organizations:

* Use the Apel 112 App, which automatically transmits geographic coordinates from your mobile phone to the 112 Service if you have an active data connection and a compatible phone with location functionality. The app is available in both English and Romanian.
* Call +40 021.9590 to reach the Romanian Border Police, where you can obtain public information about crossing or border areas. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania

answers.answer:
Yes, here are some general guidelines and requirements for contacting 112:

* The 112 emergency number should be used in case of emergencies such as accidents, natural disasters, fires, medical emergencies, etc.
* It is a national service available across Romania, so you can call it from any public telephone network.
* If you don't speak Romanian, you can request help by saying "Salut. Sunt refugiat din Ucraina. Nu vorbesc română." (Hello. I am a Ukrainian refugee. I don't speak Romanian).
answers.bResponse:
Yes, here are some general guidelines and requirements for contacting 112:

* The 112 emergency number should be used in case of emergencies such as accidents, natural disasters, fires, medical emergencies, etc.
* It is a national service available across Romania, so you can call it from any public telephone network.
* If you don't speak Romanian, you can request help by saying "Salut. Sunt refugiat din Ucraina. Nu vorbesc română." (Hello. I am a Ukrainian refugee. I don't speak Romanian). For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/info-on-romania
